title: Mozambique insurgency: Militants beheading children, aid agency reports
description: Families tell Save the Children how children as young as 11 are being beheaded by jihadists.

title: AstraZeneca vaccine: 'No indication' of link to blood clots
description: The European Union's medicines regulator makes statement after countries halt use of the Covid-19 vaccine.

title: Prince Philip: Duke of Edinburgh leaves hospital after a month
description: The 99-year-old Duke of Edinburgh returns to Windsor Castle following a successful heart procedure.

title: Integrated review: UK to lift cap on nuclear stockpile
description: The UK will also shift focus towards Indo-Pacific countries, following a year-long foreign policy review.

title: New safety measures after Sarah Everard killing
description: Moves include a pilot scheme to put plain-clothes police in clubs and extra funding for lighting.

title: Ibrahimovic reverses retirement and is recalled by Sweden aged 39
description: Sweden's record goalscorer Zlatan Ibrahimovic has been recalled to the national team, five years after announcing his retirement.

title: Southampton striker Adams in Scotland squad for World Cup qualifiers
description: Southampton striker Che Adams is called up to Steve Clarke's Scotland squad for this month's World Cup qualifiers.

title: Golden Globe awards make diversity pledge after publicists' backlash
description: The awards' organisers have been criticised for "discriminatory behaviour" and "ethical impropriety".

title: Sarah Everard: Trial date set for murder accused PC Wayne Couzens
description: Met officer Wayne Couzens will next appear at the Old Bailey on 9 July for a plea hearing.

title: Lockdown Learning: What educational resources are on TV, iPlayer and online?
description: As most pupils return to school, the BBC will continue to offer a wealth of educational material.

title: Ford chooses Dagenham for new Transit engines
description: The company says the move will help to safeguard jobs at the site, which currently employs 1,900 people.

title: "We were the only people there to support them"
description: At the start of the pandemic Hannah swapped going to college to become a cleaner in a care home.

title: Yaphet Kotto: James Bond villain and Alien actor dies at 81
description: The actor played Dr Kananga in Live and Let Die, and was also a crew member in Alien.

title: Lions & Ireland forward Stander to retire at end of season
description: Ireland and Munster back row CJ Stander announces that he will retire from rugby at the end of this season.

title: Lionel Messi scores twice as he equals Xavi's Barcelona appearance record in 4-1 win
description: Watch highlights of Barcelona's 4-1 win over SD Huesca - including two goals from Lionel Messi as he equals Xavi's all-time Barcelona appearance record.

title: Greggs to open shops despite first loss in 36 years
description: The bakery chain is confident of long-term recovery despite sales being hit amid the pandemic.

title: ‘Smell-o-vision’ brings The Gruffalo to life for visually impaired
description: Cupcakes, grass and musty farmyard smells represent characters in the children’s story The Gruffalo.

title: Newspaper headlines: UK defends Oxford jab and vigil policing fallout
description: Decisions by EU countries to pause the use of the Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccine leads the papers.

title: 'Solidarity and survival': Streamed play has Sheffield songs and steel
description: A streamed play marries monologues about "strength" with songs by Sheffield's musical heroes.

title: France to return Klimt painting sold under duress during Nazi era
description: A Jewish family was forced to sell Rosiers sous les Arbres after the Nazis annexed Austria in 1938.

title: Bitcoin: Fake Elon Musk giveaway scam 'cost man £400,000'
description: A German man lost 10 Bitcoin to so-called giveaway scammers on Twitter and experts say scams are rising.

title: So you want a career in building computer games?
description: A career in computer games can be rewarding but tough to get into.

title: Why are flowers getting more expensive?
description: Increased demand, Brexit costs and Covid-related supply issues have all pushed the price of flowers up.

title: Theatres 'ready to fight' after year 'from hell'
description: One year since UK theatres shut, industry figures discuss the dire financial impact and reopening plans.

title: 'I don't really know the people I star with'
description: Thirteen-year-old Jordan Nash has shared screen time with Hollywood superstars Will Smith and Angelina Jolie.

title: How Meghan and Harry interview felt familiar to biracial people
description: The Meghan Markle and Prince Harry interview felt familiar to many people in multi-racial families.

title: Covid lockdown: Charities warn cancer death rate could rise
description: Nearly 50 cancer charities send a stark warning about the impact Covid-19 has had on UK cancer care.

title: South Korean artist highlights gay rights in military
description: Artist and activist Jeram Kang says he was sexually harassed while serving in the South Korean military.
